Pre-Game Insights: Both the Milwaukee Brewers and the San Francisco Giants are looking for a series win with a victory on Thursday.
The Brewers are 39-25 in home games and 76-56 overall, with a collective.331 on-base percentage, the second-ranked percentage in the NL.
The Giants are 29-39 in road games and 67-67 overall, with a record of 32-49 in games where they have given up at least one home run.
This will be the third time the teams have faced each other this season.
William Contreras has 18 home runs, 58 walks, and 76 RBI while hitting.283 for the Brewers.
Jackson Chourio is 10-for-40 with two doubles, a triple, a home run, and seven RBI over the past 10 games.
Matt Chapman has 32 doubles, a triple, and 21 home runs for the Giants.
Heliot Ramos is 11-for-37 with three doubles and three home runs over the last 10 games.
